title: Dining Assistant Interview
Interview Descriptions: The interview is with the Human Resource and Dining Manger. The process was smooth reviewing overall of the job description along with wrap up questions. Received response on an offer in a timely manner.
Interview Questions: Experience with residents and kitchen/service as it’s a plus!

title: Sales and Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Ecumen in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: They have you interview three times: one over the phone, and two in-person. The second and third interview are the same questions, just with different staff in attendance each time.
Interview Questions:
1. Do you have any experience working in the medical field
2. How would you take a phonecall from a person who is looking to have their parent enroll with Ecumen
3. What makes you a good candidate for this position

title: Sales Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Ecumen (Minneapolis, MN) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: This was my second time interviewing for this company and it was a sincere interview process and a community that better fit my strengths and location preferences. There were four interviews due to meeting the various team and corporate support due to some returing at different times from out of town.
Interview Questions: What would my previous employers say about me?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Ecumen (Shoreview, MN) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the department Director, two women who had previously held the job I was interviewing for, and one HR rep.  I went to their headquarters in person for an hour long interview.  I was told toward the end of our discussion that I was one of the first candidates they were talking with, and that I wouldn't hear back for at least a week.  Well, the next day merely hours after my meeting everyone I received the standard "Thanks but no thanks" stock email stating "thank you for your interest...but we are looking at other candidates".  This is usually the response you get when you don't get an in person interview.  I was astounded by this - it was not only impersonal, but very rude.  I emailed two HR people to ask if they had any feedback for me, and I haven't heard one word back.  Very unprofessional.
Interview Questions: They asked all the standard pre-written H.R. questions.  Nothing original.

title: Activities Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Ecumen (Maplewood, MN) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Began with a phone interview for screening.  They followed up with in-person interview. Interviewed with human resources director and activities director. They asked standard questions that were relatively easy to answer. They were able to see that my previous experience, though not in the same field, related to the position for which I applied.

title: Marketing Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Ecumen (Saint Paul, MN) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: I went through the phone screening, which consisted of extremely typical questions - tell us about your experience, your past roles, your skills, etc. They asked me to complete a test project - a flyer about a nursing home. At that time I decided it wasn't worth the trouble and withdrew my application.
Interview Questions: Please complete a test project: nursing home flyer. (supplied with Word doc and low quality photo)

title: Activity Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Ecumen (Duluth, MN) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: the interview was comfortable and easy. they included a tour and allowed me to ask questions of them as well. I could tell from my experience during the interview that the culture was someplace I would want to work.
Interview Questions: where do you see yourself in 3 and 5 years from today
